finalescape.mapcomponent

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalescape.mapcomponent.MapComponent
      • finalescape.mapcomponent.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Coder, Teacher

    public abstract class Character
extends MapComponent
    A MapComponent for components that move. These characters typically either move forward, or turn to face a specific Direction. These Characters also contain an Inventory, or ArrayList of Items that they have.
    Author:
    Ofek Gila
    See Also:
    Inventory, Teacher, Coder

    • Method Detail

      • moveCharacter

        public boolean moveCharacter(int x,
                             int y)
        Tries moving Character toward specific x and y coordinates. Only moves if in one of the 4 Directions, and if it isn't facing that coordinate, then it turns instead.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if moved, false if invalid (both x and y different, which would mean not in one of the 4 Directions, or if turned instead).

      • moveCharacterDelta

        public boolean moveCharacterDelta(int dx,
                                  int dy)
        Moves this Character with a specific delta x and delta y. Calls the moveCharacter(int, int) method.
        Parameters:
        dx - delta x
        dy - delta y
        Returns:
        true if moveCharacter(int, int) returned true, false otherwise

      • moveRandomly

        public boolean moveRandomly()
        Moves this Character randomly. 50% chance to try to move forward, and 50% chance to try to either turn or move forward.
        Returns:
        true if moved, false otherwise

      • moveForward

        public boolean moveForward()
        Tries moving this Character forward using moveCharacterDelta(int, int).
        Returns:
        true if moved forward, false otherwise

      • turnMove

        public boolean turnMove()
        Tries to either turn or move this Character forward.
        Returns:
        true if moved, false otherwise

      • getDirectionTowards

        public Direction getDirectionTowards(int x,
                                     int y)
        Gets the Direction towards a specific coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        Direction towards coordinate

      • setMoveDirection

        public void setMoveDirection(int dx,
                             int dy)
        Sets this Character's Direction given a specific delta x and delta y.
        Parameters:
        dx - delta x
        dy - delta y

      • canMoveHere

        public boolean canMoveHere(int x,
                           int y)
        Checks if this Character can move to a specific coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if this Character can move there, false otherwise

      • tryMovingInDir

        public void tryMovingInDir(Direction dir)
        Tries moving this Character in a specific Direction. If it can't move, it tries moving randomly.
        Parameters:
        dir - Direction to move

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()
        Returns this Character's Inventory.
        Returns:
        this Character's Inventory

      • useSelectedItem

        public void useSelectedItem()
        Use the selected Inventory item.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from class: MapComponent
        Destroys this MapComponent (by default removes from map), but can be overridden.
        Overrides:
        destroy in class MapComponent
        See Also:
        Failure.destroy()
